page.title: 15A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A MUM
page.content: My mother is woken by her alarm at 5.59a.m. to start another busy day. She takes her daughter, Vicki, to a training session at the swimming pool from 6.30 to 7.30, then she cooks breakfast for her family and does some chores. She goes to work at 9.00 having dropped Vicki at school. As an assistant at Southgate West School she rushes from one job to another record- ing videos, counting money, typing letters, giving first aid, setting up science lessons. She rushes home for a sandwich between 12 and 12.30. Work over at 3.30 she collects Vicki to go for a piano lesson at 4.30 then home for a snack before Vicki goes to orchestra practice. Mum can then relax with her husband. She then tidies up the house, washes up perhaps, and makes her way to bed at about 10.30, to read for a while.
